title: Rakesh Sharma, First Indian To Fly To Space, Speaks To NDTV: Top Quotes
content: Rakesh Sharma, the first Indian to fly to space, speaks to NDTV about the upcoming Axiom-4 space mission and other topics.

title: Pakistan's Controversial Detention Law In Balochistan, What It Means
content: The legislation allows military and intelligence agencies, including the Pakistan Army and ISI, to detain individuals for up to 90 days without filing any formal charges or presenting them in court.

title: Tamil Nadu Poll Plan, BJP's Ties With Allies Focus Of Amit Shah's Visit Today
content: Union Minister Amit Shah is visiting Madurai on Sunday to review the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)'s preparedness and strengthening of ties with its allies ahead of the high-stakes Tamil Nadu assembly elections.

title: How An Indian Student In US Lost $5,000 To Fake Immigration Officers
content: Shreya Bedi, a Masters student at Indiana University Bloomington came to the United States in 2022 on an F-1 visa and was duped by scammers pretending to be Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents.

title: "When Arrogance...": Goa Minister 'Loses Cool', Fires Top Hospital Official
content: Health Minister Vishwajit Rane fired the Chief Medical Officer of the Goa Medical College and Hospital in public view.

title: "No Time To...": NDTV Accesses Cops' Letter Hours Before Bengaluru Stampede
content: The police force deployed at the Karnataka Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru had warned against the idea of holding the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB)'s IPL trophy celebrations at the grand stairs of the premises.

title: 2 Girls Kidnapped From Wedding, Gang-Raped By 4 Men In Odisha: Police
content: Two girls, aged 14 and 15, were allegedly kidnapped from a wedding ceremony and gang-raped by four men in Ganjam district of Odisha earlier this week, police said.

title: China Expert Warns Of "Something Worse" Than Covid After US Fungus Smuggling Case
content: A top US-based expert on China has warned of "something worse" than Covid if the United States is not careful, days after two Chinese scientists were charged with allegedly smuggling a toxic fungus into the US.

title: "If Elon Chilled Out...": JD Vance On Elon Musk-Donald Trump Feud
content: Elon Musk is making a "huge mistake" by targetingthe President of the United States, JD Vance has said.

title: Mother Of Colombian Leader Shot In Head Was Kidnapped By Pablo Escobar
content: Diana Turbay was a journalist and was kidnapped in 1990 by a group working under drug lord Pablo Escobar. She died in a failed rescue attempt.

title: Body Of Girl, 9, Found Inside Suitcase In Delhi, Cops Suspect Sex Assault
content: Crime and FSL teams are currently inspecting the spot. CCTV footage from the neighbourhood is being scanned to identify the accused.

title: Video: Protesters Pour Petrol On Head, Threaten To Set Themselves On Fire In Manipur
content: A group of young men poured petrol on their heads and threatened self-immolation in Manipur's capital Imphal over the arrest of a key leader of the Arambai Tenggol (AT), a volunteer group of the Meitei community.

title: Indore Couple Was Seen With 3 Men Before Disappearing in Meghalaya: Guide
content: A tourist guide on Saturday claimed that the honeymoon couple from Indore, Raja Raghuvanshi and his wife Sonam, was accompanied by three men on the day they went missing from Meghalaya's Sohra area.

title: Devendra Fadnavis Responds To Rahul Gandhi's "Match-Fixing" Article With An Article
content: Devendra Fadnavis' response comes a day after Rahul Gandhi, in an op-ed, questioned the way the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections were conducted.

title: Watch: Pune Road Turns Into 'Wave Pool' After Heavy Rain
content: A viral video shows a bus, partially submerged in the floodwater, moving slowly as the water formed waves.

title: Devendra Fadnavis' "Begani Shaadi Mein..." Quip On Thackerays Patch-Up Buzz
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis declined to respond to the media reports of possible reconciliation between Uddhav Thackeray and his cousin and Raj Thackeray.

title: US Believes Russia Response To Ukraine Attack Not Over Yet: Officials
content: The United States believes that Russian President Vladimir Putin's threatened retaliation against Ukraine over its drone attack last weekend has not happened yet in earnest and is likely to be a significant, multi-pronged strike, US officials said.

title: Karnataka Civic Worker Beaten With Bat, Beer Bottles For Removing Birthday Banner
content: At least seven people have been arrested for allegedly attacking Karnataka civic workers for removing an unauthorised birthday banner.

title: Relentless Dvalishvili taps O'Malley to retain title
content: Merab Dvalishvili kept coming at Sean O'Malley, ultimately submitting him in Round 3 to remain bantamweight champ Saturday night at UFC 316.

title: Wright reportedly won't be in mix for Knicks job
content: Former Villanova coach Jay Wright confirmed that he is not interested in the Knicks' head coaching vacancy and wishes to remain retired, according to Seth Davis.

title: Derby victor Sovereignty returns to win Belmont
content: Sovereignty bested Journalism on Saturday in a Kentucky Derby rematch to win the 157th Belmont Stakes, and the second hosted at Saratoga.

title: Sources: Rodgers with Steelers, inks $13M+ deal
content: Aaron Rodgers has signed a one-year, $13.65 million deal with the Steelers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, a deal that includes $10 million guaranteed.

title: Red Sox prospect Anthony hits longest HR of '25
content: Roman Anthony, ESPN's No. 1-rated prospect, smashed a 497-foot grand slam for Boston's Triple-A team Saturday night, the longest home run in affiliated baseball this season.

title: Sky deflated by 'heartbreaking' Vandersloot injury
content: Sky guard Courtney Vandersloot was carried off the court after going down with a right knee injury midway through the first quarter of Saturday's loss to the Fever.

title: Keyshawn Davis in altercation after brother's loss
content: Keyshawn Davis' nightmarish week ended in disaster Saturday night when he and his younger brother were involved in a backstage altercation following older brother Kelvin's loss to Nahir Albright.

title: Ex-MMA star Askren in hospital with severe illness
content: Former MMA champion Ben Askren was hospitalized after developing severe pneumonia, his wife posted on social media on Saturday.

title: 💬 LeBron James and more react to Gauff's win
content: Coco Gauff won her second major trophy, defeating Aryna Sabalenka in the French Open final, and social media reacted accordingly.

title: Alcaraz vs. Sinner: Who will win the  title?
content: The final we've been waiting for: Alcaraz and Sinner will face off for the French Open title. Who will prevail? Our experts weigh in.

title: NCAA athlete pay: Here's what's next
content: Schools will begin directly paying their athletes in less than a month, thanks to a legal settlement that was officially approved in federal court Friday. However, the situation is far from settled.

title: Turkey loss gives Poch, USMNT more questions than answers
content: In its first pre-Gold Cup tuneup, the short-handed USMNT looked no closer to fixing its uninspired play.

title: Let's match top NBA draft prospects to pro players: Our 14 best comps in the 2025 class
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo shares high- and low-end comparisons for projected lottery picks, including Cooper Flagg.

title: Meet the QBs in the 2026 NFL draft class: Strengths, weaknesses for 22 intriguing prospects
content: Will Cade Klubnik, LaNorris Sellers or Drew Allar be QB1 in next year's draft? And who are the other names to know in the class?

title: Vick, Iverson ... Keyshawn? Norfolk roots connect Davis to sports legends
content: Michael Vick, Allen Iverson, Pernell Whitaker... and Keyshawn Davis? Meet the newest face in sports to come out of Norfolk, Virginia.

title: Chaos at Money in the Bank: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: USMNT sees positives despite 3rd straight loss
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino insists his players deserved better after falling 2-1 to Turkey on Saturday to suffer a third consecutive loss.

title: Pochettino dismisses Spurs links: 'Not realistic'
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino shut down rumors linking him to the Tottenham Hotspur managerial vacancy, labeling the idea "not realistic."

title: Sources: Liverpool return with $153m Wirtz bid
content: Liverpool have stepped up their pursuit of Florian Wirtz by lodging an improved £113m bid for the Bayer Leverkusen playmaker, sources have told ESPN.

title: Tuchel blasts England's lack of quality and energy
content: Thomas Tuchel criticised England's "lack of urgency, lack of quality and lack of energy" after watching them scrape past Andorra 1-0 on Saturday.

title: Ronaldo 'almost certain' not to play at CWC
content: Al Nassr and Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo said on Saturday he did not plan to play at the Club World Cup in the United States.

title: Sources: Arsenal in advanced talks to sign Kepa
content: Arsenal are closing in on a deal to sign goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga from Chelsea, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Frank, Silva lead Tottenham shortlist
content: Brentford boss Thomas Frank and Fulham manager Marco Silva lead Tottenham Hotspur's shortlist to replace Ange Postecoglou, sources have told ESPN.

title: The incredible never-before-told story of the home run ball that turned Derek Jeter into 'Mr. November'
content: Fistfuls of flying dollars, an alert vendor and a Jeter signature. Here's the tale of one of MLB's most famous artifacts.

title: 2025 Mountain West Conference preview: Can Boise State do it again?
content: The Broncos, the Group of 5 standard-bearer, reached the CFP. They might be MWC favorites, but others in the league made big moves.

title: 'The Game 1 collapse was insane': What led the Knicks to fire Tom Thibodeau
content: Despite back-to-back 50-win seasons, whispers about Tom Thibodeau's future in New York had percolated for months.

title: Can Man United resolve Sancho, Rashford, Antony, Garnacho transfer stress?
content: As Man United try to rebuild after a disastrous season, getting the wrong players out matters as much as getting the right ones in. So what can they do about four talented players without a future at Old Trafford?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle could end Grealish's Man City exile
content: With Jack Grealish seemingly on the outside looking in at Man City, Newcastle are offering him a way out.

title: Ranking every WNBA team's roster core, 1-13: Which team has the best young players?
content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: Plucked from Dunkin', QB J'Mar Smith leads the Stallions into the playoffs
content: Smith, a former Stallions signal-caller, had given up on football before a string of injuries brought about his return.

title: Ranking the top 64 NHL draft prospects, including projected ceilings and floors
content: There is no hockey left to be played this season for the top players available June 27-28. Here's how they stack up.

title: A song of ICE and fire: How Trump's immigration raids sparked the LA riots
content: Trump’s memo referred to the protests as a “form of rebellion.” By invoking the same clause Lyndon B. Johnson once used in 1965 to protect civil rights protesters in Alabama, Trump flipped the script: this time, troops weren’t defending dissent—they were suppressing it.

title: 'This land was meant for his future': Father clings to son’s grave who died in stampede
content: A deadly stampede outside Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations claimed 11 lives and injured 75. Heart-wrenching stories emerge, including a father's inconsolable grief at his son's grave.

title: '11 years and no press conference': Congress slams PM Modi
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi, suggesting his tenure is nearing its end and highlighting perceived failures in governance and international relations. Khera pointed to Pakistan's continued diplomatic and military gains, despite recent terror attacks, citing Chinese arms deals, investments from Azerbaijan, and financial support from the World Bank and IMF.

title: India’s 2011 WC-winning squad: Kohli stands alone as last active member; Chawla retires
content: Fourteen years after India's 2011 World Cup victory, Virat Kohli remains the sole active player from that iconic squad, following Piyush Chawla's recent retirement. The departure of Chawla marks the end of an era, with legends like Dhoni, Tendulkar, and Yuvraj having already retired. Kohli's enduring presence symbolises the passage of time and the legacy of India's cherished triumph.

title: Tech jobs: Microsoft CEO's advice for Computer Science students; All of us..
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advises aspiring tech professionals to prioritize computational thinking fundamentals, even with AI's growing influence. He emphasizes the importance of logically breaking down problems and designing systematic solutions. Nadella also revealed that AI now contributes significantly to Microsoft's code, writing up to 30% of it.

title: India's auto industry seeks govt help on rare earth magnet imports from China
content: The Indian automobile industry is seeking government intervention to expedite Chinese approvals for rare earth magnet imports, crucial for electric vehicles and car components. Restrictions imposed by China on rare earth element exports are causing supply chain disruptions. Automakers are exploring alternatives, but immediate solutions are limited, potentially leading to production delays and increased costs.

title: Ex-convict who killed 5 in 1993 held again in Bikaner; had built temple on govt land
content: Bikaner police have arrested Shribhagwan, a 50-year-old man, for allegedly raping two minor sisters, aged 7 and 9. Investigations revealed a disturbing past, as Shribhagwan was previously convicted of murdering five family members during a 1993 robbery. Released in 2013, he lured the girls with promises before the assault, threatening them afterward.

title: Tesla Optimus chief resigns: Thanks Musk in his farewell post; says ‘You have …'
content: Milan Kovac, Tesla's Optimus robot project head, has resigned to spend more time with family abroad after nine years with the company. This transition occurs as Tesla intensifies its focus on autonomous technology and robotics. Ashok Elluswamy, currently leading Tesla’s Autopilot team, will assume Kovac’s responsibilities amidst challenges like rare-earth magnet export restrictions.

title: Blackmailed with private pics, doctor kills woman in Chennai
content: In Chennai, Doctor Santosh Kumar was arrested for the murder of Nithya. Nithya blackmailed him for money. She threatened to release his private pictures. Santosh gave her sedative-laced alcohol. He then smothered her. He stole gold jewellery from her home. Police found the jewellery with a neighbor. They are investigating if Nithya blackmailed others.

title: ‘His heart is in the right place’: Vance defends Musk
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, US Vice President JD Vance has stepped in to mediate, characterizing Musk's recent outbursts as emotionally driven but ultimately well-intentioned. Vance defended Trump's handling of the situation, suggesting restraint and emphasizing the president's desire to avoid a prolonged conflict. Despite disagreements, Vance lauded Musk's entrepreneurial spirit and defended the administration's policies.

title: Bill Atkinson dies; he helped Steve Jobs create Lisa; read CEO Tim Cook's post
content: Bill Atkinson, the Apple designer behind the Lisa and Macintosh graphical user interfaces, has passed away at 74 due to pancreatic cancer. Instrumental in creating user-friendly interfaces, Atkinson developed QuickDraw and conceived HyperCard, influencing the World Wide Web. Tim Cook mourns the loss of a visionary whose work will forever inspire.

title: Rs 4.58cr gone! How former ICICI staff pulled off big fraud
content: Sakshi Gupta, a former ICICI Bank relationship manager in Kota, was arrested for a multi-crore fraud spanning two years. She illicitly accessed over 110 customer accounts, diverting funds into stock market investments and breaking fixed deposits. The fraud, discovered after an internal probe, involved unauthorized overdrafts, debit card usage, and a fraudulent personal loan, leading to significant financial losses for customers.

title: Cockroach crawls over paneer rolls at Mumbai Theobroma
content: A Theobroma outlet in Mumbai faced criticism after a customer shared a video of a cockroach on paneer rolls. The incident sparked numerous complaints online regarding hygiene standards at various restaurants, including Theobroma branches. Customers recounted finding plastic, metal wires, and ants in their food, raising concerns about brand accountability and franchising practices.

title: Monkey pulls off ‘heist’ worth Rs 20 lakh at Banke Bihari temple
content: A monkey in Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple stole a purse containing diamond jewellery worth over ₹20 lakh. The incident triggered an unusual police investigation. Authorities reviewed CCTV footage to track the monkey's movements. After an eight-hour search, police recovered the purse from a bush. The jewellery was found intact.

title: Despite World Bank raising threshold, India achieves big dip in extreme poverty
content: Recent World Bank data reveals a significant decline in India's extreme poverty rate, dropping from 27.1% in 2011-12 to 5.3% in 2022-23, lifting nearly 270 million people out of extreme poverty. This reduction is attributed to updated poverty line definitions and improved household survey data. Free food transfers and a narrowing rural-urban poverty gap also contributed to this progress.

title: Man kills partner in fit of rage; dumps body in suitcase in UP
content: In a shocking incident, Satendra Yadav has been arrested for allegedly murdering his girlfriend, Neelesh, in Delhi. Motivated by a financial dispute and suspicions of infidelity, Yadav strangled Neelesh, packed her body in a suitcase, and disposed of it in Hapur, Uttar Pradesh.

title: Colombian presidential candidate shot in head twice during rally
content: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe was shot during a campaign event in Bogotá's Fontibón district, as confirmed by the national police. Bogotá Mayor Carlos Galán reported that Uribe is receiving emergency medical care, with the city's hospitals on alert. The suspected attacker has been arrested.

title: 'Partied till 2.30am': Hyderabad techies die in horrific car crash
content: A weekend getaway turned tragic when two young corporate employees died in a car crash near Hyderabad. The accident occurred early Sunday morning after a party at a farmhouse, with preliminary investigations suggesting drunk and negligent driving as the cause.

title: 'I have come to surrender': Bengaluru man beheads wife after fight over affair
content: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru, M Shankar surrendered to Suryanagar police, carrying his wife S Manasa's severed head on his scooter. He confessed to killing her after a dispute over an alleged affair. The couple, both factory workers, had a three-year-old daughter. Neighbors reported hearing a violent altercation before the gruesome act.

title: Is Taylor still friends with Blake? Fallout from Baldoni lawsuit continues
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, despite recent public appearances, navigate the shadow of the Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni legal situation. Sources reveal Kelce is Swift's support system amidst the drama, influencing their preference for Florida's privacy over New York. The couple briefly halted joint appearances post-Super Bowl LIX due to heightened attention.

title: Can your daily cup of tea hurt your kidneys? What science says
content: Many people start their day with chai, but excessive tea consumption may strain kidneys due to oxalates. Black tea, especially in large quantities, raises kidney stone risk. A rare case highlighted kidney failure from excessive iced tea. While chai with milk might be less risky, moderation is key, especially for those prone to kidney issues.

title: UP shocker: Man slits throat in Bakrid ‘sacrifice’; probe on
content: On Bakrid in Deoria, Uttar Pradesh, a 60-year-old man named Ish Mohammad allegedly slit his throat in a self-sacrifice. He left a suicide note stating his intention to offer himself to Allah, similar to sacrificing a goat. He bled for nearly an hour before being discovered and later died from his injuries at a hospital.

title: Watch: Team India hits the ground running: BCCI shares first training visuals
content: Team India has commenced its preparations for the highly anticipated five-Test series against England. A behind-the-scenes video released by the BCCI showcases the team's intensity and camaraderie as they settle into English conditions. The squad, led by new captain Shubman Gill and head coach Gautam Gambhir, is seen engaging in football sessions, sprint drills, and throwing exercises at Lord's.

title: Who is Madhavi Latha? Engineer who braved mountains for world's highest Chenab Bridge
content: Dr. G Madhavi Latha, an IISc professor, played a crucial role as a geotechnical consultant for 17 years on the Chenab Bridge project, advising on slope stabilization and structural safety.

title: 'Devil in the Ozarks': Fugitive killer and ex-police chief Grant Hardin recaptured near Arkansas
content: Grant Hardin, the "Devil in the Ozarks," was recaptured in Arkansas after escaping prison. He was found near the facility he fled, attempting to escape again before being apprehended. Hardin, serving sentences for murder and rape, had escaped in a makeshift uniform due to a tower guard's error.

title: Trump warns Musk of 'very serious consequences’ if he backs Democrats
content: Donald Trump has warned Elon Musk of “serious consequences” if he supports Democrats following a fallout over the GOP's budget bill. The rift began after Musk criticized the bill, leading to Trump expressing disappointment and accusing Musk of disrespect. Musk retaliated by calling for Trump's impeachment and reviving old allegations.

title: 'We were stuck for nearly 40 minutes': 62-year-old Delhi tourist dies in Mussoorie
content: A Delhi man died in Mussoorie due to a suspected heart attack, exacerbated by severe traffic and ambulance unavailability. His family struggled for over an hour to cover a short distance despite police escort. The incident highlights Mussoorie's traffic crisis and ambulance shortage, with only a few ambulances serving the Dehradun region.

title: Manipur suspends internet for five days in five districts amid unrest
content: Manipur government has suspended internet services in five districts, including Imphal West and East, for five days due to escalating law and order concerns. This decision follows protests sparked by the arrest of an Arambai Tenggol leader, alongside intensified security operations that led to the arrest of militants and recovery of weapons. The state remains tense amidst ongoing ethnic conflict.

title: 'Riots, looters...will be solved': Trump deploys 2k troops as LA unrest grows
content: President Trump threatened federal intervention in Los Angeles due to protests against immigration raids, criticizing Governor Newsom and Mayor Bass. Clashes escalated in Paramount as agents deployed tear gas, leading to arrests, including union leader David Huerta. Senator Schumer condemned Huerta's arrest, alleging suppression of free speech, while Homeland Security vowed prosecution for obstructing law enforcement.

title: 'Can't play as impact player': Kohli's statement sparks speculation - was he targeting someone?
content: After Royal Challengers Bengaluru's historic IPL victory in 2025, Virat Kohli's remarks ignited widespread discussion. Following RCB's final win against Punjab Kings, Kohli emphasised his commitment to all-round contribution. He stated his desire to give his all on the field until he retires, highlighting his aversion to being just an 'impact player'.

title: Pakistan's demand to chair 4 UN terror-related panels snubbed, finally given only one
content: Pakistan's aspirations to lead multiple key UN Security Council terrorism-related committees have been largely unmet, securing only the chairship of the 1988 Taliban Sanctions Committee. Other UNSC members rebuffed Pakistan's demands for leadership roles, leading to delays in committee allocations. India views this outcome as a reflection of Pakistan's limited standing and credibility within the UN.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Cops had warned against feting RCB at legislature
content: A senior police officer's warning about security risks at RCB's IPL victory celebration was ignored, leading to a stampede that killed 11. The officer had cautioned against the event at Vidhana Soudha due to potential overcrowding and inadequate security. Political figures are now demanding accountability from top officials for allegedly rushing the event without proper safety measures, despite prior warnings.

title: BRS MLA from Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills, Maganti Gopinath passes away
content: Maganti Gopinath, BRS MLA from Jubilee Hills, died on Sunday. He suffered a heart attack on June 5 and was under treatment. The three-time MLA was 62 years old. Gopinath started his political career with the Telugu Desam Party. He won as an MLA in 2014, 2018 and 2023. K Chandrasekhar Rao and other leaders expressed their condolences.

title: 'You need to come sit in dugout': Ponting to Preity Zinta, justifies aggressive nature on pitch
content: Despite the loss in the final to Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Punjab Kings earned praise for an impressive campaign under Ricky Ponting. The Australia legend opened up about his aggression during games and the way he switches back to being cool outside of cricket. PBKS co-owner Preity Zinta was handed a rare offer by the coach.

title: Thug Life day 3: Kamal Haasan film sees small uptick | Rs 30.15 crore collected
content: Mani Ratnam and Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' experienced a slow start at the box office, earning Rs 30.15 crore in India over three days. After a significant drop on Friday, Saturday showed a modest increase, fueled by Tamil Nadu occupancy, especially in Chennai. However, the film struggles in the Hindi belt, facing challenges in connecting with North Indian audiences due to underwhelming reviews.

title: 'Favourite city': Jadeja shares stylish pictures; Team India in England for Test series
content: Team India has arrived in London for the highly anticipated five-Test series against England, commencing June 20. Shubman Gill is set to captain the side for the first time in the longest format. Ravindra Jadeja shared photos on social media, showcasing his relaxed mood in London.

title: 'No red lines': Al-Qaeda Yemen threatens Trump, Musk; uses Gaza as rallying cry
content: Al-Qaeda's Yemen branch leader, Saad bin Atef al-Awlaki, threatened Donald Trump and Elon Musk over the Gaza conflict in his first public appearance since assuming leadership in 2024. He urged lone-wolf militants to assassinate leaders in Egypt, Jordan, and Gulf Arab nations, while the group seeks to reclaim relevance amidst the Houthi's growing popularity by portraying concern for Gaza.

title: IPL 2025: Patidar breaks tradition for Kohli after RCB win — Watch the viral video
content: Following RCB's triumph in the IPL final, captain Rajat Patidar announced that the win was dedicated to RCB's trusted talisman Virat Kohli, who has been with the team since the start of the competition in 2008. The captain was also spotted breaking a tradition in the final and urged Kohli to take center stage in the celebrations.

title: Passport of Rajasthan staffer held for spying reveals 4 Pakistan trips
content: Rajasthan Police discovered Shakur Khan's passport, revealing multiple trips to Pakistan, including one in March 2025. Khan, an assistant administrative officer, is accused of aiding Pakistani visa applications and collaborating with a Pakistani official expelled from India. Over 25 individuals who received visa assistance are being interrogated as the investigation expands, focusing on Khan's espionage activities and connections.

title: Rahul's claims absurd, bring into disrepute Cong's own polling reps, say EC officials
content: Election Commission officials have strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of "fixing" the Maharashtra polls, dismissing them as absurd and disrespectful to the electoral process. The EC emphasized the transparency of the elections, highlighting the involvement of Congress's own booth level agents in the process.

title: Commandos plan final assault on Maoist top guns in Abujmarh
content: Maharashtra's C-60 commandos are preparing for a final assault on Abujmarh, the Maoist headquarters, following the CM's visit. Simultaneously, Odisha police are intensifying searches in Sambalpur forests due to an influx of Maoists from Chhattisgarh. The operation aims to eliminate the Maoist presence, focusing on key leaders like Bhupathi and Kosa, who are evading capture in the challenging terrain.

title: Telangana Cabinet expansion: A calculated move towards social justice
content: Telangana Cabinet expansion prioritises social justice with representation from marginalised communities, setting the stage for political evolution.

title: Telangana Cabinet expanded with inclusion of Vivek Venkataswamy, Vakiti Srihari and Adluri Lakshman Kumar
content: CM Revanth Reddy prefered striking social balance in Cabinet expansion; strength of Telangana Cabinet reached 13.

title: CM Stalin’s ambition of winning over 200 seats in 2026 Assembly election is a daydream: Edappadi Palaniswami
content: More political parties will join the AIADMK coalition soon, strengthening its alliance, said the AIADMK leader

title: Active COVID-19 cases in India cross 6,000-mark
content: Kerala continues to be the most affected state, followed by Gujarat, West Bengal and Delhi, according to the ministry.

title: Local people find a tiger and dog trapped in a composting pit in a cardamom plantation in Idukki
content: According to Kottayam Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) N. Rajesh, the tiger may have chased the dog, causing both animals to accidentally plunge into the steep and circular trench

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer congratulates athlete Jyothi Yarraji
content: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer said Jyothi Yarraji made the people of Andhra Pradesh as well as the nation proud with her achievement

title: Assam flood situation improves, 3.37 lakh in 12 districts affected
content: An official bulletin said that the total death toll in this year’s floods and landslides is at 23, including six killed in mudslides, till Saturday

title: How maths helped identify fake paintings and other matters
content: Eight decades ago, G.H. Hardy wrote in his classic A Mathematician’s Apology, “ A mathematician, like a painter or a poet, is a maker of patterns. If his patterns are more permanent than theirs, it is because they are made with ideas”

title: Bengaluru stampede: Police flagged lack of time to prepare and make security arrangements, document shows
content: This letter is the only document that shows the State government overruled concerns raised by the Bengaluru City Police and went ahead with RCB victory celebrations.

title: Arrest of Arambai Tenggol leaders triggers violence in Manipur
content: Protestors have called a 10-day shutdown across the five districts of Imphal Valley after the government suspended Internet services and imposed restrictions

title: Helicopter arranged for evacuation of stranded locals, taxi drivers from landslide-hit north Sikkim
content: Responding to distress calls from a few locals and some taxi drivers seeking evacuation, the government hired the chopper to rescue them from Chaten in north Sikkim

title: Tirupati laddu row: Kiran Rayal demands arrest of TTD former Executive Officer Dharma Reddy
content: The JSP leader announced to write a letter to CM and Deputy CM to probe into Dharma Reddy’s role in ghee adulteration

title: NDA government redefined women-led development in 11 years: PM Modi
content: In all sectors, including science, education, sports, start ups and the armed forces, women are excelling and inspiring several people, Mr. Modi said

title: Andhra Pradesh teachers’ transfers, promotions in online mode to ensure transparency and efficiency: official
content: Transition to online counselling for teacher promotions and transfers addresses inefficiency, transparency issues, and inequity in manual processes

title: Onset of monsoon over Jharkhand likely around mid-June
content: The monsoon hit Kerala on May 24 this year, a week ahead of schedule. Normally, the southwest monsoon makes its onset over Kerala by June 1 and covers the entire country by July 8

title: News in Frames | From ashes, they rise
content: Amid cross-border shelling, devastation, and displacement, the resilient people of Jammu and Kashmir endure, standing strong through the toughest times

title: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar to visit France, EU and Belgium from June 8
content: During his visit to France, Jaishankar will be participating in the inaugural edition of the Mediterranean Rasina Dialogue which is being held in Marseille.

title: Pilot meets Gehlot, invites him to programme on father's 25th death anniversary
content: Ties between Mr. Pilot and Mr. Gehlot were strained after the political crisis that hit the Ashok Gehlot-led government in 2020

title: Fadnavis steers clear of buzz over possible Thackeray, Pawar family reunions
content: Over the past few weeks, there has been a growing buzz about a possible reunion between the NCP, headed by Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, and NCP (SP), led by his uncle Sharad Pawar.

title: 15-year-old boy’s electrocution ignites political fire in Kerala’s Nilambur bypoll
content: Congress workers launched a protest accusing the government of the responsibility. They blocked the road leading to the Government Taluk Hospital at Nilambur. Police arrested and forcibly removed the protestors

title: Water dispute: HC dismisses Punjab's plea seeking recall or modification of May 6 order
content: Punjab and Haryana had been at loggerheads over the distribution of water with the AAP government refusing to share water from Bhakra Dam, saying the neighbouring State has already utilised its share of water

title: 86.5 lakh deaths in 2022, 15% dip over COVID-hit 2021: CRS data
content: The dip of 15.74 lakh from 2021 brought mortality figures broadly back in line with pre-pandemic patterns last seen in 2020

title: Dog carries newborn's body in its jaws at M.P. hospital; probe on
content: A security guard managed to retrieve the body after shooing away the dog at the civil hospital in Mhow, located 25 k.m. from the district headquarters, where the incident took place on Saturday

title: Soldiers injured in Operation Sindoor again ready to give befitting reply to Pakistan: BSF DIG
content: The DIG said the nation has full faith that her brave security forces will respond effectively, giving Pakistan such a lesson that it will never forget in its lifetime

title: Jubilee Hills MLA Maganti Gopinath passes away at 63
content: Maganti Gopinath began his political journey in 1983 with the Telugu Desam Party (TDP). The three-time MLA was also a film producer.

title: Germany reaffirms strong support to India in fight against terrorism: FM Wadephul
content: The discussions also focused on enhancing and deepening the multi-faceted India-Germany Strategic Partnership, built on a shared commitment to upholding a rules-based international order rooted in democratic values

title: TMC slams PM Modi for not giving credit to previous govts for Chenab rail bridge
content: In a series of posts on X, TMC leaders Derek O'Brien and Sagarika Ghose said former Prime Ministers Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Manmohan Singh should also be given credit for the rail bridge

title: Akhanda Godavari project bhumi puja scheduled for June 19 postponed, says Minister
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan will perform bhumi pujas for Akhanda Godavari project and State Forest Academy buildings by June-end, says Kandula Durgesh

title: BJP’s previous government failed to contribute towards Himachal Pradesh’s development, says CM Sukhu
content: The party kept boasting about double engine governments but it had raised substantial loans during its five-year regime in the State, he adds

title: TDP former MLA Palla Simhachalam passes away
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, IT Minister Nara Lokesh and other political leaders express condolences

title: Invite leaders from other parties to TDP only after a thorough check of their background: Naidu
content: The TDP national president’s advice assumes significance in the wake of his caution during Mahanadu that the party needs to be wary about the presence of coverts and criminals in its ranks, and the damage likely to be caused by them

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu calls for victory rallies on June 12 to mark one year of NDA rule in Andhra Pradesh
content: The coalition has been able to bring about a welcome change in the last one year and there is a need to sustain the positive momentum for the next four years, he tells party leaders

title: Focus is on enhancing diagnostic equipment in government hospitals, says Health Minister
content: A universal health insurance scheme providing a cover of up to ₹25 lakh will be rolled out soon, he says

title: Police complaints lodged against journalist for ‘offensive remarks’ against Amaravati women
content: A.P. Assembly Deputy Speaker also lodges a complaint with the DGP against the alleged derogatory remarks made by Krishnam Raju during a show aired in Sakshi TV

title: Telangana Cabinet expansion today likely on Sunday afternoon
content: A senior functionary told The Hindu that the All India Congress Committee has given its final nod to the list of names

title: Manipur government imposes curfew, Internet suspension in Bishnupur, four other districts
content: Internet services were suspended for five days in the five districts - Bishnupur, Imphal West, Imphal East, Thoubal and Kakching

title: Infosys gets huge relief on GST as DGGI closes ₹32,400-crore pre-show cause notice
content: The GST demand, in fact, exceeds Infosys’s annual profits — Infosys’s net profit for full FY25 stood at ₹26,713 crore — and its closure now is bound to come as a significant relief for the tech major

title: It was a calculated and premeditated operation in Maharashtra, says Ramesh Chennithala
content: Congress leader questioned the “addition of 7.6 million votes”, pointing out that the initial turnout on the polling day was 58.22%, which jumped to 66.05% overnight.

title: What is the COVID-19 situation in India? | Explained
content: What are the variants doing the rounds? What are the symptoms? Is the medical system prepared? Why are doctors stressing on the importance of taking basic preventive measures? What is the advice on vaccines and booster doses? Are people with co-morbidities and those who are immuno-compromised at greater risk from the virus?

title: Bihar had lowest sex ratio at birth in 2022, in decline for three years: CRS data
content: Only 891 girl babies were registered in Bihar in 2022, for every 1,000 boys; Maharashtra, Telangana, Gujarat also recorded low sex ratios at birth; deaths registered in 2022 dropped sharply from 2021, when COVID hit hardest

title: Gen. Anil Chauhan | A General for all seasons
content: The Chief of Defence Staff, who recently confirmed that India suffered losses on May 7 during combat with Pakistan, says the operation was a resounding success and that India’s defence compelled Islamabad to come to a truce on May 10

title: Shortage of dustbins, rampant garbage dumping plague TNUHDB tenements
content: While residents cite the lack of dustbins for the accumulation of waste along corridors and on the ground floor, conservancy workers complain of difficult working conditions in the tenements. The Corporation will float tenders for sanitation work in TNUHDB tenements in Zones I to X

title: T.N. government enhances Kuruvai coverage in Cauvery delta to over 5 lakh acres
content: Last year, the achievement was around 3.88 lakh acres, which was about 1.7 lakh acres short of what was covered during 2023-24

title: Jackfruit fair begins in Hubballi
content: A two-day Organic Mango and Jackfruit Fair organised by Sahaja Samrudha and Rotary Club of Hubballi has begun at Bhagini Mandal in Hubballi with Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council Basavaraj Horatti inaugurating it on Saturday.

title: Govt., Opposition trade charges over Digha Jagannath temple prasad in West Bengal
content: Sweets from local shops were being passed off as prasad from the temple, the State BJP leadership accused the West Bengal government, which refuted the allegations

title: Bihar pushes up its Ayushman Bharat health insurance coverage
content: State Government launches intensive drive to bring the poorest of the poor into the fold of assured healthcare

title: Bastar project pending for 45 years gets go ahead from PM: Chhattisgarh CM
content: PM asks CM to present ₹49,000 cr Bodhghat project to Jal Shakti Ministry; to help irrigate 7 lakh hectares, produce 125 megawatts of power; will submerge 24 villages, displace 2,000 families

title: Rahul shamelessly peddling lies on Maharashtra poll, says Nadda
content: Instead of doing introspection after poll defeat, Congress leader cooking up bizarre conspiracies, says BJP president

title: Espionage case: Punjab YouTuber remanded to police custody
content: YouTuber Jasbir Singh’s police custody extended and the lawyer says Haryana police summoned him in Jyoti Malhotra case

title: SRMIST, The Hindu to hold third webinar on multidisciplinary learning on June 10
content: Join SRMIST and The Hindu for a webinar on multidisciplinary learning for future careers on June 10 at 11.30 a.m.

title: Amit Shah in Madurai: Home Minister arrives; security beefed up in and around Meenakshi temple
content: The BJP leader is scheduled to address party functionaries as part of the Tamil Nadu BJP’s core council meeting, at a private hotel on June 8

title: Home Minister Amit Shah felicitates Chhattisgarh police officers
content: Congratulating them on the success of anti-Maoist operations, he says that the Union Government is ‘committed to freeing India from the menace of Maoism’

title: 'Criminal betrayal of our soldiers': Congress slams Modi Govt over 'failing' to isolate Pakistan
content: He claimed that the UN Security Council also named Pakistan Vice-Chair of the Anti-Terrorism Committee, just days after the terror attack on Indian soil

title: MHA to resume talks with Kuki-Zo insurgents, says camps near Meitei areas must be closed before renegotiating SoO pact
content: No immediate extension of SoO, it will be renegotiated with stringent ground rules, says Central official; SoO was signed in 2008 and extended each year till 2024 when Manipur government pulled out

title: Centre is trying to frame me: former J&K Governor
content: The case in which ex-J&K Governor Satyapal Malik has been chargesheeted involves the awarding of ₹2,200 crore worth of civil works for the Kiru Hydroelectric Project

title: Answer my questions if you have nothing to hide: Rahul Gandhi to Election Commission
content: Opposition leader questions the Election Commission’s credibility over an “unsigned” response and demands to release post-5 p.m. CCTV footage from booths in Maharashtra

title: Tension at Durgadi Fort as rival Shiv Sena factions clash during Id-ul-Azha prayers
content: Police detain members from both sides as Shinde, Uddhav groups attempt ascent to Durga temple amid prohibitory orders

title: Stop insulting people of Maharashtra, BJP leader tells Rahul Gandhi
content: BJP leader and Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule says Congress became overconfident and failed to work for Assembly elections

title: Rajasthan, Delhi police start recording iris, retina, fingerprints of all arrestees under 2022 law; no DNA collection yet
content: Data being stored in a central server; DNA collection, face-matching not mentioned under CrPI Act, but NCRB preparing guidelines to roll them out in 1,300 locations; huge forensic, logistic capabilities needed, say States

title: R.G. Kar case: Parents of deceased doctor express dissatisfaction with CBI probe
content: The parents said the CBI has not filed any supplementary chargesheet in the rape and murder case, since the first and only chargesheet filed in October 2024

title: Karnataka Transport Department partners with JICA for digital transformation
content: Following a meeting with a JICA delegation led by Yushi Nagano, Head of JICA DxLab, Mr Reddy said the initiative marks a ‘digital leap in transport.’

title: Where women turn the tide
content: In the coastal villages from Karaikal to Nagapattinam, women members of the fishing community are coming into their own, converting symbolic concessions to well-earned victories from a gender-based paradigm. They have edged themselves into the centre of the traditional village power unit vested with men; they hope to lead these panchayat bodies soon, writes Nacchinarkkiniyan M.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka govt. increases ex gratia to kin of deceased to ₹25 lakh
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday (June 7, 2025) ordered the compensation to be increased to ₹25 lakh, a statement from the Chief Minister’s Office (CMO) said.

title: Every Indian must make a vow to reduce salt, oil consumption by 10%: Nadda
content: Our traditional food includes many types of preparations with millets, which have to be revived, says Union Minister

title: Confident in PM’s wisdom on delimitation: Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu
content: In an interview to The Hindu, the Andhra Pradesh CM, who had played a critical role in the 2001 Constitutional amendment to delay the inter-State redistribution of parliamentary representation for 25 years, says Modi is very clear on keeping national interest as the most important aspect on the issue of delimitation; he also says when the Centre comes out with a policy on the issue, and if south India needs to be worried, then the issue can be discussed

title: Pre-events of Malabar River Festival to be held in 9 local bodies
content: A meeting headed by district collector Snehil Kumar Singh decided to hold local Kayaking competitions to promote local participation; selection trials for the national kayaking team will be held on July 24

title: Deportation may not require legal process: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The Assam Chief Minister cited the validity of a 1950 order to underscore the need to fast-track the detection and deportation of ‘illegal immigrants’

title: BRS faults Congress for misinformation campaign on Kaleshwaram project
content: Former Irrigation Minister T. Harish Rao counters arguments against the project with the support of documents,  blames failure of Congress govt. to get any approvals during 20017-14

title: NIA files chargesheet against Goldy Brar, four others in Gurugram club blasts case
content: Accused linked to Babbar Khalsa International; plot aimed at fuelling communal unrest and disrupting peace, says agency

title: The murder that shook a mountain
content: When 19-year-old hotel receptionist Ankita Bhandari was found dead in 2022 in Uttarakhand, residents of the Himalayan State began protesting the seeming lack of intent to solve the murder. Last week, when a local court gave three men — one politically-connected — life imprisonment, her family was relieved. Then they found out that the case could go to the High Court. Ishita Mishra reports on the parents’ agony at losing their daughter and life as they knew it

title: Finance Ministry rolls back restrictions on procurement of scientific equipment
content: Finance Ministry allows select institutions to procure equipment outside the GEM portal; move comes amid complaints from scientists over sub-standard materials affecting their research

title: EPACK Prefab opens Sandwich Panel manufacturing plant in Tirupati district
content: The facility enhances EPACK’s production capacity by adding 8 lakh sqm per annum, taking the company’s total sandwich panel capacity to 13.10 lakh sqm per annum

title: Poor rural roads in West Bengal blamed for accidents, fatalities ahead of monsoon
content: Families allege negligence amid muddy, dilapidated roads; political blame game intensifies over infrastructure woes

title: 'These are Muslim values, these are Canadian values': PM Mark Carney

title: USWNT's Lavelle returns after long injury absence
content: u.s. women's national team midfielder rose Lavelle played her first match in sixth months . lavelle underwent ankle surgery shortly after the match in 74th minute . "it was definitely a lot harder than I anticipated," she said .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Tigers No. 1 this week?
content: the Detroit Tigers have retaken the no. 1 spot and are one of four AL teams in the top 10 in week 10 . the national league is still well-represented at the top of our list . a number of clubs have continued their fall down our rankings this week .

title: How the spoils will get divided from NCAA settlement
content: university of Alabama athletic director Greg Byrne has worked in college athletics for over three decades . he's seen it all, at least until late Friday night, when he began officially facing a new challenge . the settlement allows athletic departments to pay out about $20.5 million directly to their players .

title: Juan Soto, the showman, has finally shown up -- is he about to go on a tear?
content: the new york Mets gave him the richest contract in sports history . he won with enthralling walks, commanding attention as much between pitches as during the action . soto shook his head and strutted his hips and he Soto Shuffled .

title: Why Vasiliy Lomachenko was different from the rest

title: GOAT debate revived? Dvalishvili taps out O'Malley
content: merab Dvalishvili beat Sean O'Malley to retain the men's bantamweight title . Kayla Harrison knocked off Julianna Pea to claim the women's championship . it's expected that Cory Sandhagen will challenge the new title-holder . MMA GOAT, Amanda Nunes, will return to face the winner of Harrison-Pea .

title: The Thunder's five-step plan to avoid a 2-0 NBA Finals hole
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder forced 25 turnovers in Game 1 of the NBA Finals . their star point guard scored 38 points, 24 more than their opponent's star guard . the Indiana Pacers went into Oklahoma City and stole Game 1 by a 111-110 score .

title: Tyrese Haliburton has made the leap, and the Thunder should be terrified
content: the Pacers beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 111-110 in game 1 of the NBA Finals . he hit the shot with 0.3 seconds remaining in the game . the homage to Reggie Miller has taken place over the past few weeks .
